titleStmt.title: By the King, a proclamation. James R. Whereas for remedy of the present scarcity of money in this our kingdom, and that our standing forces may be the better paid and subsisted, and that our subjects of this realm may be the better enabled to pay and discharge the taxes, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook and Samuel Helsham assigns of Benjamin Tooke printer to the Kings most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold at at the Kings printinghouse on Ormonde-Key, and the Colledge-Arms in Castle-street.,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title and opening lines of text.
"Given at our court at Dublin castle the 18th day of June, 1689."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
